definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education

sentences.english: At present , Moral lesson in junior middle school has already generally implemented the open-book examination.
sentences.chinese: 目前，初中思想品德課已普遍實行了開卷考試。

sentences.english: If you are given an open-book exam, you will forget your book.
sentences.chinese: 如果讓你開卷考試，你會忘了帶書。

sentences.english: A good book could interest readers at the beginning, and benefit readers in the end.
sentences.chinese: 一本好書能開卷引人入勝，終卷使人獲益非淺。

sentences.english: High speed decoiler with cantilever support, adopting ground recoiling reduces the heavy labor of excavating a pit.
sentences.chinese: 採用高速懸臂開卷，地面放卷，減少開挖地坑之苦。

sentences.english: So it＇s not definitely helpful to open all books.
This article can make your open a book good below the hope.
sentences.chinese: 希望下面這篇文章能夠使你開卷有益。

sentences.english: The PHM-1400 pallet decoiler is ideal for unwinding coils from pallets.
sentences.chinese: 托盤開卷機是從托盤退卷的理想選擇。

sentences.english: Coiler cost estimate is performed through self-learning method.
sentences.chinese: 以開卷機爲例對自學習式成本估算法進行驗算。

sentences.english: Every Friday will be an open-book test on the work done for the week.
sentences.chinese: 每週五我們都會依據本週所學進行一次開卷測試。

sentences.english: Each unit of tests has a time limit of one hour, and all tests are open-book based.
sentences.chinese: 每個單元的測試均限時一個小時，答題過程完全開卷。

sentences.english: The exam is open book and consists of multiple choice questions.
sentences.chinese: 考試是開卷考試，由若干選擇題組成。

sentences.english: That is a good book which is opened with expectation and closed with profit.
sentences.chinese: 好書開卷引人入勝，閉卷使人得益。

sentences.english: This is an open-book exam, you don't have to worry too much.
sentences.chinese: 這是開卷考試，你們不用太過擔心。

sentences.english: Not until then did I understand reading benefits a lot.
sentences.chinese: 直到那時我才理解了開卷有益的含義。

sentences.english: Professor Taylor sometimes will give a take-home exam or an open-book exam.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒教授有時會進行家庭作業式的考試開卷考試。

definition: to put pen to paper/pen mark
old anecdote/stories passed on from former times
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
